items.title: All Season

items.title: All Terrain
items.description: All-terrain tires offer drivers traction on- and off-road, and are typically used by light truck and SUV drivers who want a tire that's able to climb rocks and perform on the highway.

items.title: Highway
items.description: Highway terrain tires are commonly used on light trucks and SUVs that typically haul materials or need to conquer highways and some off-road terrains.

items.title: Winter
items.description: For snow, ice, and freezing temperatures

items.title: All Weather
items.description: Combines an All Season and Winter tire traits for strong traction year-round

items.title: Mud Terrain
items.description: Mud Terrain tires offer drivers traction on off-road terrains such as mud, dirt, sand, gravel, and rock, and are commonly used on CUVs, SUVs, light trucks, and jeeps.

items.title: Performance
items.description: For sport/luxury vehicles and high-speed handling

items.title: Summer
items.description: For dry roads and warm, arid climates

items.title: Touring
items.description: For durability and smooth long rides

items.title: UHP
items.description: Used on sports and super cars in warm weather, sporty handling, and quick acceleration

header.subtitle: Consistently rated as excellent by 235-70r16 drivers
Most popular among drivers in PA
Check out the sale price on this tire
Consistently rated as excellent by 235-70r16 drivers

content.body:
### Shop LT235/70R16 Tire Size The LT235/70R16 tire size is a pretty common one among older vehicles, since newer trucks have tended toward taller rim sizes. You can find LT235/70R16 tires on trucks like the Dodge Dakota, Ford E150 Econoline, Ford Explorer and Jeep Cherokee, as well as a few SUVs and crossovers like the Honda Pilot and Nissan Pathfinder. For most drivers of light trucks and SUVs, all-season tires are a good choice for their balance of good handling, low noise, a forgiving ride and year-round traction even in light snow. Some premium LT235/70R16 all-season tire suggestions would include the [Pirelli Scorpion Verde All Season Plus II](https://simpletire.com/brands/pirelli-tires/scorpion-verde-all-season-plus-ii), Bridgestone Dueler H/L 422 Ecopia, Continental CrossContact LX25, Falken Ziex CT60 A/S, and Hankook Dynapro HP2 (RA33). Popular vehicles: 1987-2004 Dodge Dakota
2004-2006 Ford E150 Econoline
1995-2010 Ford Explorer
2001-2012 Jeep Cherokee
2003-2008 Honda Pilot
2005-2014 Nissan Pathfinder If you have a light truck equipped with 4WD and like to take it off the pavement from time to time, all-terrain tires are the way to go. All terrain tires feature a more aggressive tread and reinforced carcass that can easily handle mud, sand, loose soil and gravel while still offering good road manners and a comfortable ride on the highway. Check out tires like the [Toyo Open Country A/T III](https://simpletire.com/brands/toyo-tires/open-country-a-t-iii), BFGoodrich All-Terrain T/A KO2, Yokohama Geolandar X-AT, or General Grabber A/TX. Maybe the winters get really harsh where you are, with several inches of snow that stays around for weeks on end and subfreezing temperatures. All-terrain tires typically can’t get the job done in tough winter conditions because their rubber formulation hardens in the cold (think about the traction of a hockey puck vs. a rubber snow boot). If that’s the case, consider dedicated winter tires like the Bridgestone Blizzak DM-V2, Continental VikingContact 7, Nokian Nordman7 SUV, or [Sumitomo Ice Edge](https://simpletire.com/brands/sumitomo-tires/ice-edge). Whether you drive a Dodge Dakota, Honda Pilot, Jeep Cherokee, or something else, SimpleTire has a set of 235/70R16 tires that meets your needs at a great price!

info.title: Did you know?
info.body: A reliable brand is the #1 ask for most drivers. Here you can shop all the most popular brands and discover new ones – all tested, ranked and rated by our customers.
